name: places/ChIJZ3m5L6xZwokRq3Gyu3EDuuE
formattedAddress: 21 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 21 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text:
What a fantastic wine bar. I had been eyeing it for months before they finally opened their doors earlier this year. It exceeded my expectations and has really become a mainstay for me and my friends.

First: the wines. Fernando has worked very hard to curate this wine selection. The price points are SO approachable, and you‚Äôll find incredible wines from regions that aren‚Äôt typically sourced from. If this intimidates you, no problem, Fernando is a Michelin star trained sommelier, so just tell him what you tend to pick up from your wine shop and he‚Äôll have just the wine in mind for you. I prefer to get the quartino size because the pours are $1-3 more for about another half glass of wine, and their pineapple spritz is amazing.

Next: the atmosphere. As a Clinton street resident, this part was important. I have plenty of neighborhood friends, and so far this summer, brick has left their doors pretty wide open, so you get to see the bustle of the city and can often flag down a friend you might find walking on the street. Fernando and Andrew will talk to you like you‚Äôre old friends. The music is fantastic, and they take care to keep it very clean. Domingo always greets you with a water and a smile.

Last but certainly not least: the food. Andrew has definitely had his ear to the ground in terms of listening to what the people of Clinton street want. The menu is ever-evolving at this point and he‚Äôs always testing out new things while keeping the core of the dish intact. In recent memory, my favorite new addition (no pictures because I inhaled them) might be chips with jam√≥n, shaved manchego, and chili oil that are just to die for.

I really can‚Äôt wait to see this place become a mainstay and a staple for the people of New York. It‚Äôs hard to find a place this dedicated to service and vibes post-pandemic and I know they‚Äôre gonna go far just for that!

originalText.text: We had a lovely date night here at Brick.  Our server was so fun and was able to pick out a great wine for us by asking us a few questions.  The wines here are not your typical wines, they are something new and different you won‚Äôt find anywhere else.

originalText.text: So glad my friend and I wandered in here a few days ago. Fernando was so lovely and somehow knew my love for Georgian wine? Maybe he‚Äôs magic? Also razor clams and pan con tomate was freakin delicious! So excited to return and try all the other goodies. So glad to have this spot in my neighborhood ü´∂üèΩ

originalText.text: A must-go for anyone looking for the perfect ambiance to enjoy some exquisite wine paired with some delicious food. Not to mention Fernando is the BEST. You'll feel right at home.

text.text: A must-go for anyone looking for the perfect ambiance to enjoy some exquisite wine paired with some delicious food. Not to mention Fernando is the BEST. You'll feel right at home.

originalText.text:
I've had the pleasure of visiting this fantastic wine bar on the Lower East Side multiple times, and each visit leaves me more impressed than the last. This place has become my go-to spot for good reason!
First and foremost, the wine selection here is impeccable. Whether you're a seasoned wine enthusiast or just starting to explore, you'll be spoiled for choice. From crisp whites to robust reds, they have an impressive range that caters to all tastes. But what sets this place apart is the owners' extensive knowledge and passion for wine. They are not only welcoming but also eager to help you discover the perfect wine to suit your preferences.
Speaking of coming back, it's the owners' warm and friendly nature that truly makes this place feel like home. Their kindness and genuine interest in their patrons make every visit a memorable one. They're not just owners; they're hosts who welcome you with open arms and make you feel like a valued guest.
If you find yourself in the Lower East Side and in search of a wine  bar, this is the place to be.
